text: Probably related to `hs_context` variable. See <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Conversion-page-not-showing-up-after-API-Post/m-p/233469>
I passed hs_context inside body but still getting same issues.
Maybe try to change value to see if it changes something. If the context is not found, probably you have an error in it. I can't do more, sorry. :confused:
Amazing, thank you *so* much <@UJJ239SC9>, this is exactly what I needed! :smile:
what did you do - change to underscores or something maybe?

Hi dev people,
I'm working with a client with the goal of using custom behavioral events to track abandoned carts in Magento/Adobe Commerce. I haven't worked with custom events before, and am feeling a bit lost here. Has anybody worked on anything like this, and would be willing to point me in the right direction and/or share some github examples?
New here, Hey HubSpot Dev Community. I have couple of concern regarding listing integration my app for HubSpot Marketplace, can you suggest who is right person to talk in detailed. :innocent:
hey zach! pm of custom events here
feel free to set some time! or send any qs async
<https://HubSpot.com/meetings/maggie-philbin>

Hello, Is it possible to prefil a form when clicking on a CTA button?

So lets say the user clicks on a CTA button that links to a landingspage with a form. is it possible to prefill from what page it came? with the use of the cta?

Hey Bent :grin: you can, if you add the the name of the page along with the form field to the location url of the cta it should prefill, more info here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/can-i-auto-populate-form-fields-through-a-query-string>
Hello! I have a problem what could cause a hubdb not showing on my listing page only when I use "hsDebug=true" or "?hsCacheBuster=3388" in the link it shows the items from the hubdb
I use `{% include '../partials/results.html' %}`  Could this have effect?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hi everyone! I've been working on adding the tracking code to our platform so that users get identified to HubSpot with their e-mails after logging in and so that we can send them directed CTAs using segmentation lists. We have successfully added the tracking code and we can confirm,  by looking at the requests that are sent to HubSpot from the browser, that the e-mails are being correctly sent to HubSpot.

However, the CTAs are presenting a strange behaviour. Sometimes they will show up right after the identification with the tracking code, but sometimes they will take very long to show or will never show (after ~5 min.). Using the same login, same browser and same settings we've seen some cases in which in a first logins the CTAs never show up, then after some retries (with new cookies, using the anonymous tab), the CTAs start showing up, but then after some other retries they stop showing up again, even with the CTA configured to always repeat and to show after 1 second in the page.

Can you please help me to understand if this behaviour could be caused by something we've been doing wrong? We've already read the docs (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/install-the-HubSpot-tracking-code>) many times and can't figure it out.
I would just post specific questions here and you may get better responses
Hi, I have been having trouble with the webhooks using API it seems it didn't sent the info from HubSpot to our dialer. Does anyone can help?

Has anyone here ever pulled in calendar availability (probably would be using Google Calendar) to a contact record? The use case would be scheduling independent contractors for interview automatically, but their availability would need to be in HubSpot somehow. Using a free HubSpot seat with no record access and having them connect their calendars isn't an option until we get the ability to create custom user properties - the scheduling needs to take into account things like skill level and YoE.
thanks scott, I make it specific one!
